instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message:
Having a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 model,<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

got liquid spilled on <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR>, replaced.

check <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL>,shorted to ground. found that <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> is bad, replaced, <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR>.

Everything looks ok, then connected to charger. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> normal around 12. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> is present and close to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

pp3v3 s5 is present,3.3v.  don't see any other obvious spilled area.  really get stuck now, any advice would be apprecaited

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> will have shorted and put 12V to the CPU, guess what......

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message: shit ,every time for these <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards man. the lowest success rate model ever for me
